query_name: Bug Reporter Behavioral Patterns - Before and After First Bug Report
data_limitation: Most bug tickets (Dec 2024 - Apr 2025) occurred before the events table time range (Mar 2025 - Jun 2025), limiting before/after event analysis
key_findings: Bug reports happen VERY QUICKLY after signup: median 6 days, avg 14 days
Most bug reporters (95.24%) only open ONE bug ticket - not repeat reporters
LIMITED data overlap: 17 out of 21 bug reporters have no events in 7-day window around bug report
Events data starts AFTER most bug tickets were filed, limiting temporal analysis
Admin role dominates bug reporting: 52.38% of bug reporters
Bug reporting appears to be tied to ONBOARDING phase (median 6 days)
Very few users become 'serial bug reporters' (only 1 user with 2 tickets)
business_implications: Bug reports cluster in the ONBOARDING/EARLY USAGE period (first 1-2 weeks)
This suggests bugs are discovered during initial product exploration
Most bugs are reported ONCE by users, not repeatedly
Admin users report more bugs - possibly due to broader product access/usage
Product should focus on IMPROVING ONBOARDING to reduce early-stage bug encounters
data_quality_note: The misalignment between bug ticket dates (Dec 2024-Jun 2025) and events dates (Mar 2025-Jun 2025) significantly limits our ability to analyze triggering events. Future analyses should ensure data coverage alignment.
